items.author: Martin Fowler
items.text: Any fool can write code that a computer can understand. Good programmers write code that humans can understand.

items.author: Chris Heilmann
items.text: Java is to JavaScript what car is to Carpet.

items.author: John Johnson
items.text: First, solve the problem. Then, write the code.

items.author: Dan Salomon
items.text: Sometimes it pays to stay in bed on Monday, rather than spending the rest of the week debugging Mondayâ€™s code.

items.author: Anonymous
items.text: In order to understand recursion, one must first understand recursion.

items.author: Burt Rutan
items.text: Testing leads to failure, and failure leads to understanding.

items.author: Grace Hopper
items.text: The most damaging phrase in the language is.. it's always been done this way

items.author: Joyce Wheeler
items.text: Sometimes it's better to leave something alone, to pause, and that's very true of programming.
